text.__SUMMARY__:
Acacia drewiana is a shrub of the genus Acacia and the subgenus Pulchellae. It is native to an area in the Wheatbelt and Peel regions of Western Australia.The shrub typically grows to a height of 0.15 to 0.9 metres (0.5 to 3.0 ft). It blooms from April to July and produces yellow flowers.
There are two recognised subspecies:

Acacia drewiana subsp. drewiana
Acacia drewiana subsp. minor
